sections.paragraphs:
{{Infobox given name2 | name = Alexius | image= | image_size= | caption= | pronunciation= | gender =male | meaning = | language = Greek | seealso = [[Alexia (given name)|Alexia]] (female)
[[Alexey]] }} '''Alexius''' is the [[Latinization (literature)|Latinized]] form of the given name '''Alexios''' ({{lang-el|Αλέξιος}}, polytonic {{lang|grc|Ἀλέξιος}}, "defender", cf. [[Alexander]]), especially common in the later [[Byzantine Empire]]. Variants include '''[[Alexis (disambiguation)|Alexis]]''' with the Russian '''[[Alexey|Aleksey]]''' and its Ukrainian counterpart '''Oleksa/Oleksiy''' deriving from this form. The female form is '''[[Alexia (given name)|Alexia]]''' ({{lang-el|Αλεξία}}) and its variants such as [[Alessia]] (the masculine form of which is [[Alessio (disambiguation)|Alessio]]) in Italian.

sections.paragraphs:

* [[Alexios II Komnenos]] (1167–1183), Byzantine emperor
* [[Alexios III Angelos|Alexios III]], Byzantine emperor
* [[Alexios IV]], Byzantine emperor
* [[Alexios V]], Byzantine emperor
* [[Alexios I of Trebizond]], Emperor of Trebizond
* [[Alexios II of Trebizond]], Emperor of Trebizond
* [[Alexios III of Trebizond]], Emperor of Trebizond
* [[Alexios IV of Trebizond]], Emperor of Trebizond
* [[Alexius Mikhailovich]] (1629–1676), Tsar of Russia
* [[Alexius Petrovich]] (1690–1718), Russian tsarevich

sections.paragraphs:

* [[Alexius of Nicaea]], metropolitan bishop
* Saint [[Alexius of Rome]], fifth-century eastern saint
* Alexius, a monk and saint of Kiev - see [[Abraham and Onesimus of Kiev]]
